options_subtitle.message: This extension connects your browser to the Technitium DNS Server API to control DNS adblocking per client and to comfortably allow (temporarily) blocked domains.

options_li_show_blocked.message: Show blocked domains (from Technitium query logs, filtered to your client IP).

options_li_compare_page.message: Match with the current page: shows which blocked domains belong to the page.

options_li_whitelist.message: Whitelist with one click: Allow / Temp Allow directly in the popup.

options_note_query_logs.message: Prerequisite: Query Logs must be enabled in Technitium (SQLite).

options_legend_first_text.message: Domain shares the same base domain as the currently visited site (heuristic).

options_legend_third_text.message: Domain differs from the site's base domain (tracker/CDN/ads etc.). In the popup, you'll see the 3rd tag.

options_legend_type_text.message: Additional badges indicate the resource type for a domain (e.g. IMG, JS, CSS, XHR, FONT, FRAME, MEDIA). If there are more than two types, the UI shows a compact +N tag. Types are inferred from the current tab's resource timings.

options_legend_hot_text.message: Left marker means: this domain was blocked very often in the logs (currently: from 20×).

options_legend_allowed_text.message: Highlighted in green + badge "Allowed": this domain is already on the allowlist. In the popup you'll see "Remove Allow".

options_legend_btn_allow_text.message: Adds the domain to the allowlist (permanent, depending on your Technitium setup).

options_legend_btn_remove_text.message: Removes the domain from the allowlist (Allowed Zones).

options_legend_btn_temp_text.message: Allows the domain temporarily (duration configurable in settings).

options_legend_since_text.message: Uses only log entries since the page was loaded (instead of "last X seconds").

options_legend_only_text.message: Hides the second list ("More blocked domains") so you can focus on the current page.

options_legend_allowstatus_text.message: Marks already allowed domains (badge "Allowed") and shows "Remove Allow" instead of "Allow".

options_help_language.message: By default, the extension uses your browser's UI language. You can override it here.

options_help_theme.message: By default, the extension follows your browser theme (light/dark). You can force Light, Gray, or Dark here.

options_help_logwindow.message: How far back the extension searches the query log by default (when "Since page load" is off).

options_help_tempallow.message: How long "Temp Allow" temporarily allows a domain.

options_help_showallowstatus.message: Marks already allowed domains (badge "Allowed") and shows "Remove Allow" instead of "Allow".

options_footer_note.message: Note: This extension does not read page contents. For page matching, it only uses hostnames of network resources (performance entries) in the current tab.

manifest_description.message: Control Technitium DNS adblocking and inspect blocked domains per page.
